lines.content: * Represents the commands available in the application.
* Each command corresponds to a specific action that can be taken by the user.
* Returns the corresponding {@code Command} for the given string.
* If the provided string does not match any known command, {@code null} is returned.
* @param command The string representing the command.
* @return The corresponding {@code Command}, or {@code null} if no match is found.
* The {@code CommandHandler} class is responsible for processing user commands.
* It parses input strings to identify commands and execute corresponding actions
* Handles user commands by parsing the input string and executing the corresponding actions.
* Recognizes commands such as MARK, UNMARK, BYE, LIST, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, DELETE, HELP, and FIND.
* @param input The user command input string.
* @return {@code CommandHandlerOutput} The updated task list, and
*        a boolean indicating whether the BYE command was executed.
* @throws EmptyDescriptionException If a task command lacks a description.
* @throws UnknownCommandException If the command is not recognized.
static CommandHandlerOutput handleCommand(TaskList prevList, String input)
static TaskList handleMark(TaskList list, String[] tokens) {
static TaskList handleUnmark(TaskList list, String[] tokens) {
static TaskList handleTodo(TaskList list, String input) throws EmptyDescriptionException {
static TaskList handleDeadline(TaskList list, String input) throws EmptyDescriptionException {
static TaskList handleEvent(TaskList list, String input) throws EmptyDescriptionException {
static TaskList handleDelete(TaskList list, String[] tokens) {
static void handleFind(TaskList list, String[] tokens) {
* The {@code CommandHandlerOutput} class is a container for the output
* of a command handler in the Duke application.
* It stores the current state of the {@link TaskList} and a boolean flag indicating
* whether the command issued was a "bye" command.
* Constructs a {@code CommandHandlerOutput} object with the specified task list
* and a flag for the "bye" command.
* @param taskList the current state of the task list
* @param isByeCommand {@code true} if the command is "bye", {@code false} otherwise
* The {@code Message} class contains constant strings that represent various messages and command formats used.
* The {@code MyException} class contains constant error messages used
* throughout the application to describe various exceptions.
public static final String EMPTY_DESCRIPTION = "Description cannot be empty.";
public static final String INVALID_DATE = "Invalid date specified.";
public static final String UNKNOWN_COMMAND = "Unknown command.";
* The {@code CommandFormat} class contains constant strings that define
* the format for various commands accepted by the application.
* The {@code Greeting} class contains constant strings that the application
public static final String STARTUP_STATEMENT_ONE = "Hello! I'm Panorama";
public static final String STARTUP_STATEMENT_TWO = "What can I do for you?";
public static final String EXIT_STATEMENT = "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!";
* Thrown to indicate that a task description is empty.
* This exception is used to signal that a user-provided input for a task
* does not include a required description.
* Constructs a new {@code EmptyDescriptionException} with a default error message.
* Thrown to indicate that an invalid date has been specified.
* This exception is used to signal that the date provided by the user
* does not conform to the expected format or is otherwise invalid.
* Constructs a new {@code InvalidDateException} with a default error message.
* Thrown to indicate that an unknown command has been issued.
* This exception is used to signal that the user has entered a command
* that is not recognized by the application.
* Constructs a new {@code UnknownCommandException} with a default error message.
* Represents a deadline task with a name and a due date.
* A deadline task has a specific date and time by which it should be completed.
* Constructs a {@code Deadline} task with the specified name and due date.
* @param name The name or description of the deadline task.
* @param date The due date and time for the task.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task in a format suitable for file storage.
* The format includes the task details and the due date, separated by '|'.
* @return A formatted string for writing the deadline task to a file.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task for displaying in the user interface.
* The format includes the task details and the due date.
* @return A formatted string representing the deadline task.
* Represents an event task with a name and a time range.
* An event task has a start date and time and an end date and time.
* Constructs an {@code Event} task with the specified name, start date, and end date.
* @param name The name or description of the event task.
* @param from The start date and time of the event.
* @param to The end date and time of the event.
public Event(String name, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {
* Returns a string representation of the event task in a format suitable for file storage.
* The format includes the task details, start date, and end date, separated by '|'.
* @return A formatted string for writing the event task to a file.
* Returns a string representation of the event task for displaying in the user interface.
* The format includes the task details, start date, and end date.
* @return A formatted string representing the event task.
* Represents an abstract task with a name, status, and type.
* Subclasses should extend this class to define specific types of tasks.
* Constructs a {@code Task} with the specified name and type.
* The task is initialized as not done.
* @param name The name or description of the task.
* @param taskType The type of the task, represented as a character.
* Sets the completion status of the task.
* @param isDone {@code true} if the task is completed, {@code false} otherwise.
* Returns a string representation of the task in a format suitable for file storage.
* The format uses '|' as a separator between fields.
* @return A formatted string for writing the task to a file.
* Returns a string representation of the task for displaying in the user interface.
* The format includes the task type, completion status, and task name.
* @return A formatted string representing the task.
* A todo task is a simple task with a name and no specific time or deadline.
* Constructs a {@code Todo} task with the specified name.
* The task type is automatically set to 'T'.
* @param name The name or description of the todo task.
* Main class for the Panorama application.
* Handles user interactions, command processing, and task management.
* Main method to run the Panorama application.
* Initializes the task list, loads previous tasks, handles user input, and saves tasks before exiting.
// Save task list to file after exiting
* Provides utility methods for parsing and formatting dates.
* Supports conversion between string representations and {@code LocalDateTime} objects.
private static final DateTimeFormatter INPUT_FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HHmm");
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy HHmm");
* Parses a string in the format "yyyy-MM-dd HHmm" into a {@code LocalDateTime} object.
* @param dateStr The date string to be parsed.
* @return A {@code LocalDateTime} object representing the parsed date and time.
* @throws DateTimeParseException If the provided string cannot be parsed into a date.
public static LocalDateTime parse(String dateStr) throws DateTimeParseException {
* Returns a string representation of the {@code LocalDateTime} object in the format "MMM dd yyyy HHmm".
* This format is suitable for displaying to users in the terminal.
* @param dateTime The {@code LocalDateTime} object to be formatted.
* @return A string representing the date and time in the specified output format.
* Returns a string representation of the {@code LocalDateTime} object in the format "yyyy-MM-dd HHmm".
* This format is suitable for storing date and time on disk.
* @param dateTime The {@code LocalDateTime} object to be formatted.
* @return A string representing the date and time in the specified storage format.
* Parses user input to create {@code Task} objects.
* Supports parsing input for todo, deadline, and event tasks.
* Parses input to create a {@code Todo} task.
* The input should be in the format "todo `name`", where `name` is the description of the task.
* @param input The user input string to be parsed.
* @return A {@code Todo} task with the specified `name`.
* @throws EmptyDescriptionException If the input does not contain a task description.
public static Todo parseTodoInput(String input) throws EmptyDescriptionException {
* Parses input to create a {@code Deadline} task.
* The input should be in the format "deadline `name` /by `date`", where `name` is the description
* of the task and `date` is the due date.
* @param input The user input string to be parsed.
* @return A {@code Deadline} task with the specified `name` and due `date`.
* @throws EmptyDescriptionException If the input does not contain a task description or date.
public static Deadline parseDeadlineInput(String input) throws EmptyDescriptionException {
* Parses input to create an {@code Event} task.
* The input should be in the format "event `name` /from `start_date` /to `end_date`",
* where `name` is the description of the task, `start_date` is the start date and time,
* and `end_date` is the end date and time.
* @param input The user input string to be parsed.
* @return An {@code Event} task with the specified `name`, `start_date`, and `end_date`.
* @throws EmptyDescriptionException If the input does not contain a task description or dates.
public static Event parseEventInput(String input) throws EmptyDescriptionException {
* Handles loading and saving of tasks from/to a file.
* Loads the task list from the file specified by {@code SAVE_FILE_NAME}.
* If the file does not exist, it returns an empty list.
* @return A list of {@code Task} objects loaded from the file.
* @throws FileNotFoundException If the file is not found.
// Note that | is a special char in regex
* Saves the current list of tasks to the file specified by {@code SAVE_FILE_NAME}.
* @param memory The list of {@code Task} objects to be saved.
* @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs while writing to the file.
* Manages a list of {@code Task} objects.
* Provides methods to add, list, mark, unmark, and delete tasks.
* Initializes the task list with a pre-existing list of tasks.
* @param list The initial list of {@code Task} objects.
* Adds a {@code Task} to the list.
* @param Task The task to be added.
* Lists all tasks in the task list.
* Each task is displayed with its index number.
* The task is identified by its index in the list.
* @param stringId The index of the task to be marked as done.
System.out.println(Ui.INDENT + "Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Marks a task as not done.
* The task is identified by its index in the list.
* @param stringId The index of the task to be marked as not done.
System.out.println(Ui.INDENT + "OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Deletes a task from the list.
* The task is identified by its index in the list.
* @param stringId The index of the task to be deleted.
// NOTE: Assume that the ID for delete is still based on the global list.
System.out.println(Ui.INDENT + "Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Handles user interaction by printing various messages to the console.
public static final String INDENT = "     "; // 5 spaces
* Displays a help message with a list of available commands.
* Sends the specified message to the console, followed by a separator.
* @param err The message to be sent.
* Handles the situation where the data.txt file is not found.
* Prints a message indicating that an empty task list is being started.
sendMessage("./data.txt does not exist. Starting from an empty task list.");
